item.title: Carol add a quote by Socrates
item.description: "To find yourself, think for yourself." -- Socrates

item.title: Carol add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Carol add a quote by Leroy Brownlow
item.description: "There are times when silence has the loudest voice." -- Leroy Brownlow

item.title: Carol add a quote by Jatakas
item.description: "The heart that boundless pity feels for all things that have birth, in such a heart nothing narrow or confined can ever be." -- Jatakas

item.title: Carol add a quote by Confucius
item.description: "Fix your mind on truth, hold firm to virtue, rely on loving kindness, and find your recreation in the Arts." -- Confucius

item.title: Carol add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "If a man does not keep pace with his companions, perhaps it is because he hears a different drummer. Let him step to the music he hears, however measured or far away." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Carol add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "I'll tell you how the sun rose, a ribbon at a time. The steeples swam in amethyst, The news like squirrels ran. The hills untied their bonnets, The bobolinks begun. Then I said softly to myself, "That must have been the sun!" -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Carol add a quote by Arabian Quote
item.description: "Your head is your house, furnish it." -- Arabian Quote

item.title: Carol add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "A conviction akin to religious feeling of the rationality or intelligibility of the world lies behind all scientific work of a high order." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Carol add a quote by Ptolemy
item.description: "Mortal as I am, I know that I am born for a day. But when I follow at my pleasure the serried multitude of the stars in their circular course, my feet no longer touch the earth." -- Ptolemy

item.title: Carol add a quote by Robert Fulghum
item.description: "Once you know where the roller coaster is going, are you in for the ride?" -- Robert Fulghum

item.title: Carol add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Time is but the stream I go a-fishing in" -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Carol add a quote by Walter Lippmann
item.description: "Where all think alike, no one thinks very much." -- Walter Lippmann

item.title: Carol add a quote by Joseph Roux
item.description: "Science is for those who learn, poetry for those who know." -- Joseph Roux

item.title: Carol add a quote by Ray Cummings
item.description: "Time is what keeps everything from happening at once." -- Ray Cummings

item.title: Carol add a quote by Eden Phillpotts
item.description: "The universe is full of magical things patiently waiting for our wits to grow sharper." -- Eden Phillpotts

item.title: Carol add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Success is stumbling from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Carol add a quote by e.e. cummings
item.description: "To be nobody but yourself in a world which is doing its best day and night to make you like everybody else means to fight the hardest battle which any human being can fight and never stop fighting." -- e.e. cummings

item.title: Carol add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "Literature and butterflies are the two sweetest passions known to man." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Carol add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Look deep into nature, and then you will understand everything better." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Carol add a quote by David Brower
item.description: "The wild places are where we began. When they end, so do we." -- David Brower

item.title: Carol add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Of all the animals, man is the only one that is cruel. He is the only one that inflicts pain for the pleasure of doing it." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Carol add a quote by Bill Yeates
item.description: "We have played god with the planet and the lives of its creatures; their ultimate fate is our responsibility. It is also our destiny." -- Bill Yeates

item.title: Carol add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Life does not consist mainly, or even largely, of facts or happenings. It consist mainly of the storm of thoughts that is forever flowing through one's head." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Carol add a quote by Max Ehrmann
item.description: "With all its sham, drudgery, and broken dreams, it is still a beautiful world. Be cheerful. Strive to be happy." -- Max Ehrmann

item.title: Carol add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "What if I should discover that the poorest of the beggars and the most impudent of offenders are all within me; and that I stand in need of the alms of my own kindness, that I, myself, am the enemy who must be loved -- what then?" -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Carol add a quote by Wallace Stevens
item.description: "Perhaps the truth depends on a walk around the lake." -- Wallace Stevens

item.title: Carol add a quote by Blaise Pascal
item.description: "Nature is an infinite sphere whose center is everywhere and whose circumference is nowhere." -- Blaise Pascal

item.title: Carol add a quote by Terry Tempest Williams
item.description:
"Tortoise steps, slow steps, four steps like a tank with a tail dragging in the sand.
Tortoise steps, land based, land locked, dusty like the desert tortoise herself, fenced in, a prisoner on her own reservation -- teaching us the slow art of revolutionary patience." -- Terry Tempest Williams

item.title: Carol add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "The appearance of things changes according to the emotions; and thus we see magic and beauty in them, while the magic and beauty are really in ourselves." -- Kahlil Gibran
